result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin Edward Hedgecock was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: DOC Collect.  If discharged from extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

supervisions.notes: Complete AODA and all treatment/counseling as necessary.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Benjamin Edward Hedgecock

records.addlTxt:
Activity: Plea/sentencing hearing 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

11:34 AM Defendant Benjamin Edward Hedgecock in court by video in custody with attorney Walter H Isaacson by video.  Cheniqua White appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives right to appear in person in courtroom. Amended Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived. Defendant pleads guilty to count 1. Court finds the defendant guilty count 1. Count 2 is dismissed and read in. Presentence investigation waived. Court orders 18 months prison and 36 months extended supervision consecutive to sentence in 22CF288.  Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program and Challenge Incarceration Program. Driver's license revoked for 36 months and IID for 36 months. A fine of $600 and costs due DOC collect. Sentence credit 62 days.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 3, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Activity: Preliminary hearing and Arraignment
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

10:44 AM Defendant Benjamin Edward Hedgecock in court in custody by video at the Rock County Jail with attorney Walter Isaacson by video. David S Olson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Officer Peter Cronin of Janesville Police Department sworn testimony taken by video; Witness identified the defendant. Court takes judicial notice of bond in case 22CF288. State moves for bind over, defense objects. Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant's attorney, reading waived. Defendant's attorney pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set, bond to continue.
Preliminary hearing on April 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Noah M Tylenda appeared for the State of Wisconsin by video means.   Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address verified.
